text: Isospidia brunneola is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by William Jacob Holland in 1893. It is found in Cameroon, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Gabon and Sierra Leone. The length of the forewings is 12.5–14 mm for males and 15.5-16.5 mm for females. The ground colour of the wings is brownish buff, speckled with brown.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology) Suppl. 3: 132 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1893 Category:Drepaninae
title: Isospidia brunneola
